title: Tomato Cucumber Salad
instructions: Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a skillet.
Step 2: Add in the chopped shallot and sliced garlic. Stir-fry for over medium heat until lightly golden.
Step 3: Remove from the heat and stir in lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
Step 4: Cut the cherry tomatoes into halves and the cucumber to 1cm dices.
Step 5: Transfer them into a salad bowl.
Step 6: Pour in the dressing and parsley. Toss gently and chill for an hour before serving.

title: Garden Fresh Heirloom Tomato, Pepper, and Cucumber Salad
instructions: Step 1: Blend all ingredients in a medium bowl.
Step 2: Add more of any ingredient that you prefer.
Step 3: Salt and pepper to taste.
Step 4: Allow the salad to set for a about 15 minutes for all of the juices to blend well together.

title: Organic Peach, Cucumber & Golden Tomato Gazpacho
instructions: Step 1: In a food processor, place all ingredients except the water and pulse until mixture is coarsely chopped.
Step 2: Add water and pulse a couple times again until the gazpacho is blended but still a little chunky.
Step 3: Place in a glass bowl and cover with plastic wrap.
Step 4: Let refrigerate for 20-25 minutes, or until well chilled.
Step 5: Serve immediately in small glasses or bowls.
Step 6: Garnish with diced peach and a cucumber round, if desired.

title: Appetizing Apple and Almond Soup
instructions: Step 1: Wash and rinse the apples thoroughly.

Step 2: Cut the apples (with their skin) as well as the gooseberry, tomatoes, and carrots roughly into chunks. Soak almonds in warm water and peel off the skin.In a deep bottomed pan or pressure cooker, boil 3 cups of water.
Step 3: Add chopped fruits, veggies, almonds.

Step 4: Let it simmer or pressure cook until 4 whistles.Puree the boiled veggies/fruits in a mixer until smooth.Sieve the soup if desired.Season with salt and sugar to taste.To make the soup creamier, add cream to the soup and simmer for another 5 minutes.

title: Baked Ratatouille
instructions: Step 1: Heat oil in a heavy, large Dutch oven over medium heat.
Step 2: Add garlic; stir 1 minute.
Step 3: Add eggplant, green bell peppers, tomatoes, onion, zucchini and basil.

Step 4: Saute for 5 minutes. Cover and simmer until all vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally, about 25 minutes.Uncover pot and simmer until juice thickens, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes.
Step 5: Mix in vinegar; season to taste with salt and pepper.Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Step 6: Spread in 9-inch pie dish.
Step 7: Sprinkle with cheese, if desired.
Step 8: Bake until heated through, about 20 minutes.This recipe yields about 3 cups.
